member.name: T:C1.Win.BarCode.C1BarCode
member.summary: Winforms control that encodes text value into barcode image.

member.name: P:C1.Win.BarCode.C1BarCode.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is encoded as a barcode image.

remarks.para: Some encodings support alpha-numeric values of any length. Others are limited to numeric values or to a specific set of characters. See the enumeration for details.
If you use characters that are invalid for the current encoding, the control will display a blank image.

member.name: T:C1.BarCode.MaxiCodeMode
member.summary: MaxiCode mode.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.MaxiCodeMode.Mode2
member.summary: US Carrier with postal codes up to 9 digits in length. Approximately 138 numeric characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.MaxiCodeMode.Mode3
member.summary: International Carrier with alpha-numeric postal codes up to 6 digits in length. Approximately 93 characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.MaxiCodeMode.Mode4
member.summary: Standard Symbol encodes general information for purposes other than the shipping industry. Approximately 90 characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.MaxiCodeMode.Mode5
member.summary: Secure Symbol encodes general information with more error correction. Approximately 74 characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.MaxiCodeMode.Mode6
member.summary: Reader Program allows scanner manufacturers to program barcode readers.

member.name: T:C1.BarCode.BarStyle
member.summary: For internal use. Defines internal barcode styles.

member.name: T:C1.BarCode.CodeType
member.summary: Type of code, or symbology, the barcode control will use to generate the barcode.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Ansi39
member.summary: ANSI 3 of 9 (Code 39) uses upper case, numbers, - , * $ / + %.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Ansi39x
member.summary: ANSI Extended 3 of 9 (Extended Code 39) uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code_2_of_5
member.summary: Code 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code25intlv
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Matrix_2_of_5
member.summary: Matrix 2 of 5 is a higher density barcode consisting of 3 black bars and 2 white bars. Matrix_2_of_5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code39
member.summary: Code 39 uses numbers, % * $ /. , - +, and upper case.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code39x
member.summary: Extended Code 39 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code_128_A
member.summary: Code 128 A uses control characters, numbers, punctuation, and upper case.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code_128_B
member.summary: Code 128 B uses punctuation, numbers, upper case and lower case.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code_128_C
member.summary: Code 128 C uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code_128auto
member.summary: Code 128 Auto uses the complete ASCII character set. Automatically selects between Code 128 A, B and C to give the smallest barcode.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code_93
member.summary: Code 93 uses uppercase, % $ * / , + -, and numbers.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code93x
member.summary: Extended Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.MSI
member.summary: MSI Code uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.PostNet
member.summary: PostNet uses only numbers with a check digit.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar uses A B C D + - : , / and numbers.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.EAN_8
member.summary: EAN-8 uses only numbers (7 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.EAN_13
member.summary: EAN-13 uses only numbers (12 numbers and a check digit). If there are only 12 numbers in the string, it calculates a checksum and adds it to the thirteenth position. If there are 13, it validates the checksum and throws an error if it is incorrect.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.UPC_A
member.summary: UPC-A uses only numbers (11 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.UPC_E0
member.summary: UPC-E0 uses only numbers. Used for zero-compression UPC symbols. For the Caption property, you may enter either a six-digit UPC-E code or a complete 11-digit (includes code type, which must be 0 (zero)) UPC-A code. If an 11-digit code is entered, the Barcode control will convert it to a six-digit UPC-E code, if possible. If it is not possible to convert from the 11-digit code to the six-digit code, nothing is displayed.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.UPC_E1
member.summary: UPC-E1 uses only numbers. Used typically for shelf labeling in the retail environment. The length of the input string for U.P.C. E1 is six numeric characters.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RM4SCC
member.summary: Royal Mail RM4SCC uses only letters and numbers (with a check digit). This is the barcode used by the Royal Mail in the United Kingdom.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.UCCEAN128
member.summary: UCC/EAN –128 uses the complete ASCII character Set. This is a special version of Code 128 used in HIBC applications.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.QRCode
member.summary: QRCode is a 2D symbology that is capable of handling numeric, alphanumeric and byte data as well as Japanese kanji and kana characters. This symbology can encode up to 7,366 characters.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code49
member.summary: Code 49 is a 2D high-density stacked barcode. Encodes the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.JapanesePostal
member.summary: This is the barcode used by the Japanese Postal system. Encodes alpha and numeric characters consisting of 20 digits including a 7-digit postal code number, optionally followed by block and house number information. The data to be encoded can include hyphens.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Pdf417
member.summary: Pdf417 is a popular high-density 2-dimensional symbology that encodes up to 1108 bytes of information. This barcode consists of a stacked set of smaller barcodes. Encodes the full ASCII character set. Capable of encoding as many as 2725 data characters.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.EAN128FNC1
member.summary: EAN128FNC1 is a UCC/EAN-128 (EAN128) type barcode that allows you to insert FNC1 character at any place and adjust the bar size etc, which is not available in UCC/EAN-128. To insert FNC1 character, set “\n” for C#, or “vbLf” for VB to Text property at runtime.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RSS14
member.summary: RSS14 is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RSS14Truncated
member.summary: RSS14Truncated is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus Indicator digits for use on small items, not for point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RSS14Stacked
member.summary: RSS14Stacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14Truncated, but stacked in two rows when RSS14Truncated is too wide.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RSS14StackedOmnidirectional
member.summary: RSS14StackedOmnidirectional is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14, but stacked in two rows when RSS14 is too wide.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RSSExpanded
member.summary: RSSExpanded is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus AI element strings (expiration date, weight, etc.) for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RSSExpandedStacked
member.summary: RSSExpandedStacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSSExpanded, but stacked in two rows when RSSExpanded is too wide.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.RSSLimited
member.summary: RSS Limited is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification with indicator digits of 0 or 1 in a small symbol that is not scanned by point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.DataMatrix
member.summary: Data Matrix is a high density, two-dimensional barcode with square modules arranged in a square or rectangular matrix pattern.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.MicroPDF417
member.summary: MicroPDF417 is two-dimensional (2D), multi-row symbology, derived from PDF417. Micro-PDF417 is designed for applications that need to encode data in a two-dimensional (2D) symbol (up to 150 bytes, 250 alphanumeric characters, or 366 numeric digits) with the minimal symbol size.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.MicroQRCode
member.summary: Micro QR Code is a variant of QR Code 2005. Compared with other regular QR Codes, it has only one position detection pattern which reduces the barcode size so that it can be used to applications where the space for barcode image is severely restricted.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.IntelligentMail
member.summary: MaxiCode is a public domain, machine-readable symbol system originally created and used by United Parcel Service.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.ITF14
member.summary: ITF14 barcode is the GS1 implementation of an Interleaved 2 of 5 bar code to encode a Global Trade Item Number. It is continuous, self-checking, bidirectionally decodable and it will always encode 14 digits. ITF-14 is used on packaging levels of a product in general.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Code11
member.summary: Code 11, also known as USD-8, is a high-density barcode symbology developed by Intermec in 1977 to numeric digits. It was primarily used to label telecommunication equipments. This symbology is discrete and is able to encode numeric digits through 0-9, dash (-), and start/stop characters.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.SSCC18
member.summary: Serial Shipping Container Code-18 (SSCC-18) Barcode. A type of barcode that can print in the lower 2-inch (or local equivalent) extended area of the Thermal 4" x 8" or 4" x 8¼" (or local equivalent) label.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Telepen
member.summary: Telepen is a name of a barcode symbology designed in 1972 in the UK to express all 128 ASCII characters without using shift characters for code switching, and using only two different widths for bars and spaces.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Pharmacode
member.summary: Pharmacode, also known as Pharmaceutical Binary Code, is a barcode standard, used in the pharmaceutical industry as a packing control system.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.PZN
member.summary: PZN or Pharma-Zentral-Nummer is a barcode standard used in the German pharmaceutical industry for designating medicines and health-care products.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.HIBCCode128
member.summary: Health Industry Bar Code 128 implementation.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.HIBCCode39
member.summary: Health Industry Bar Code 39 implementation.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.ISBN
member.summary: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is special commercial book identifier which encodes 9 numeric digits apart from the start number "978", "979".

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.ISSN
member.summary: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) is an eight-digit number used for printed or electronic periodical publications like magazines, etc. This ISSN system was drafted as an International Standard in 1971 and published as ISO 3297 in 1975.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.ISMN
member.summary: The International Standard Music Number or ISMN (ISO 10957) is a thirteen-character alphanumeric identifier for printed music developed by ISO.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Iata25
member.summary: Represents an IATA 2 of 5 barcode

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Bc412
member.summary: The BC412 barcode was invented by IBM to meet the needs of the semiconductor wafer identification application.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.Plessey
member.summary: MSI barcode, also known as Modified Plessey, is a numeric symbology developed by the MSI Data Corporation, which is used primarily for marking retail shelves for inventory control. Though continuous and self-checking, MSI Plessey provides several module checksum situations.

member.name: F:C1.BarCode.CodeType.IntelligentMailPackage
member.summary: Intelligent Mail Package Barcode.
